original_tweet.fullText:
This is wild.

Google just unleashed Gemini Robotics, bringing AI into the physical world.

Robots can now see, think, and ACT in real-time.

10 mind-blowing things Gemini Robotics can do: https://t.co/Bj8nfND0FW

threadTexts.text:
1. Dexterity

Completes precise tasks, like origami folding handled entirely by AI-driven robots ğŸ¤¯ https://t.co/v1Pq19kk0H

2. Interactivity

Understands commands in everyday language.

Quickly adapts if objects move or environment changes. https://t.co/uMkhfxugEg

3. Generality

Instantly handles new tasks and objects.

Performs tasks it's never seen before, doubling other modelsâ€™ performance. https://t.co/e7tXJvan1q

4. World Understanding (Gemini Robotics-ER)

Understands objectsâ€™ shape and position instantly.

Plans safe, accurate movements to grasp and manipulate objects. https://t.co/2xQEDB1Sy4

5. Multiple Embodiments

Works across various robots, including humanoid models like Apollo.

Easily adapts to different robotic hardware. https://t.co/bq6jXweCMR

relevant_tweets.summary: Perplexity announces the availability of its API Model Context Protocol (MCP) along with an MCP server for Sonar, enabling AI assistants to perform real-time web research with improved accuracy.

original_tweet.fullText:
The Perplexity API Model Context Protocol (MCP) is now available.

We've built an MCP server for Sonar, giving AI assistants real-time, web search research capabilities.

Powered by Perplexity, Claude can now search the web and deliver real-time and accurate insights on demand. https://t.co/TxxkaD9CLt

relevant_tweets.summary: LlamaIndex promotes integration with any Model Context Protocol server, highlighting the open-source efforts to simplify discovery and usage of AI tools.

original_tweet.fullText:
Connect your LlamaIndex agents to any Model Context Protocol server!

We're closely following progress on the Model Context Protocol, an open-source effort to make it easy to discover and use tools. Using our MCP integration, you can use the tools exposed by any MCP-compatibleâ€¦ https://t.co/4V5LguDL8X

relevant_tweets.summary: Google introduces two new AI models from Google DeepMind based on Gemini 2.0, including Gemini Robotics and Gemini Robotics-ER, aimed at advancing helpful robots through vision-language-action capabilities.

original_tweet.fullText: Introducing two new AI models from @GoogleDeepMind, based on Gemini 2.0, that lay the foundation for a new generation of helpful robots: Gemini Robotics, a vision-language-action model adds physical actions as a new modality, and Gemini Robotics-ER, a vision-language model thatâ€¦

RT @minchoi: OpenAI just dropped their Agent SDK and it's a game-changer for AI developers ğŸ¤¯

Building AI agents just went from weeks to miâ€¦

relevant_tweets.summary: Google DeepMind unveils Gemini Robotics, the latest AI models designed to enhance physical world interactions through improved reasoning, interactivity, dexterity, and generalization.

original_tweet.fullText:
Meet Gemini Robotics: our latest AI models designed for a new generation of helpful robots. ğŸ¤–

Based on Gemini 2.0, they bring capabilities such as better reasoning, interactivity, dexterity and generalization into the physical world. ğŸ§µ https://t.co/EXRJrmxGxl https://t.co/MeEkRLomXm

threadTexts.text:
Gemini Robotics can solve multi-step tasks that require significant dexterity, such as folding origami ğŸ“„ packing a lunch box ğŸ¥— and more.

See it in action â†“ https://t.co/WgHfQz8n9N
âš™ï¸ It goes head to head with our team to wrap a timing belt around gears - a feat thatâ€™s harder than you think â†“ https://t.co/Q9D5s7Md7d

Robots must be able to interact seamlessly with humans. ğŸ¤

When itâ€™s interrupted or situations change, Gemini Robotics can adjust its actions on the fly.

This level of steerability will empower us to better work with future robot assistants in the home, at work and beyond. https://t.co/3JuPAifFCX

They also accomplished tasks not seen in training, showing the ability to generalize to new scenarios. ğŸ’¡

We show that on average, Gemini Robotics more than doubles performance on a comprehensive generalization benchmark - compared to other state-of-the-artâ€¦ https://t.co/rqgRiM2hRs

Our model Gemini Robotics-ER allows roboticists to tap into the embodied reasoning of Gemini. ğŸŒ

For example, if a robot came across a coffee mug, it could detect it, use â€˜pointingâ€™ to recognize parts it could interact with - like the handle - and recognize objects to avoid whenâ€¦ https://t.co/HQMXvWLoJ5

Our ultimate goal is to develop AI that could work for any robot - no matter its shape or size.

This includes bi-arm platforms like ALOHA 2 and Franka ğŸ¦¾
but also for more complex embodiments such as the Apollo developed by @Apptronik. https://t.co/dPd5JtyWpo

We're partnering with @Apptronik to build the next generation of humanoid robots with Gemini 2.0 - and opening our Gemini Robotics-ER model to trusted testers such as Agile Robots, @AgilityRobotics, @BostonDynamics and @EnchantedTools.

Find out more â†’ https://t.co/EXRJrmxGxl https://t.co/dtEV6DX0A8

relevant_tweets.summary: Google DeepMind outlines its ambition to develop versatile AI for robots of all shapes and sizes, mentioning partnerships and examples like ALOHA 2, Franka, and Apptronikâ€™s Apollo.

This includes bi-arm platforms like ALOHA 2 and Franka ğŸ¦¾
but also for more complex embodiments such as the Apollo developed by @Apptronik. https://t.co/dPd5JtyWpo

relevant_tweets.summary: Google DeepMind and Apptronik partner to build next-generation humanoid robots, opening the Gemini Robotics-ER model to trusted testers including Agile Robots, Boston Dynamics, and others.

original_tweet.fullText:
